troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting Tips:

troubleshooting.domainFormat: Some providers require the domain without "www"

info.title: What is an Inbox Test?
info.description: We send test emails to various email providers to check whether your emails land in the inbox or spam folder.

input.label: Test Email Addresses
input.description: Enter one or more email addresses (comma-separated) to which test emails should be sent. Then check whether the emails landed in the inbox or spam folder.

excellent.title: Excellent Deliverability!
excellent.description: Your emails reliably reach the inbox.

good.title: Good Deliverability
good.description: Most emails reach the inbox, but there is room for improvement.

poor.title: Improvement Required
poor.description: Many emails land in spam. Check your sender reputation and email content.

errors.noValidEmail: Please enter at least one valid email address

step1.title: 1. Select Domain
step1.description: Choose the domain from which you want to send emails.
step1.tip: Use your main domain for best results

step2.title: 2. Specify Provider
step2.description: Tell us where your domain is registered.
step2.tip: Most domains are registered with Namecheap, GoDaddy, or Cloudflare

step3.title: 3. Add DNS Records
step3.description: Copy the displayed DNS records to your domain management.
step3.tip: The records must be copied exactly, including dots

step4.title: 4. Wait for Verification
step4.description: After adding, it takes 5-30 minutes for verification.
step4.tip: In rare cases, it can take up to 48 hours

step1.title: Locate DNS Records
step1.description: Log in to your domain provider and navigate to DNS settings.

step2.title: Add CNAME Records
step2.description: Add the three CNAME records exactly as shown.
step2.tip: Pay attention to case sensitivity and dots at the end

step3.title: Set TTL Low
step3.description: Set the TTL (Time To Live) to 300 or 600 seconds.
step3.tip: This speeds up the propagation of changes

step1.title: Automatic Check
step1.description: Click "Check DNS" to update the status.
step1.tip: The check can be repeated every 5 minutes

step2.title: Troubleshooting
step2.description: For red entries, check the copied values.
step2.tip: Most common error: whitespace at the beginning or end

step3.title: Be Patient
step3.description: DNS changes take time to propagate.

step1.title: Manage Domains
step1.description: Here you see all your configured domains.
step1.tip: Verified domains have a green checkmark

step2.title: Run Inbox Tests
step2.description: Test the deliverability of your emails.

step3.title: Add More Domains
step3.description: You can authenticate as many domains as you want.
step3.tip: Each domain improves deliverability for that specific domain

authenticate.question: Why do I need to authenticate my domain?
authenticate.answer: Without authentication, your emails are sent from a foreign domain, which increases the likelihood of them landing in spam. With your own domain, the delivery rate increases to over 95%.

duration.question: How long does verification take?
duration.answer: In most cases, 5-30 minutes. However, DNS changes can take up to 48 hours to propagate worldwide.

dnsRecords.question: What do the different DNS records mean?
dnsRecords.answer: Mail CNAME: Main record for email sending. DKIM 1 & 2: Digital signatures that prove emails really come from your domain.

multipleDomains.question: Can I add multiple domains?
multipleDomains.answer: Yes, you can authenticate as many domains as you want. Each domain works independently.

inboxTest.question: What is an inbox test?
inboxTest.answer: A test where we send emails to various providers to check if they land in the inbox or spam folder.

failed.question: My domain shows as "Failed"
failed.answer: Check: 1) Were all DNS records copied correctly? 2) Are there no spaces? 3) Was the TTL set low? After corrections, it takes up to 30 minutes again.

contentStep.placeholderStandard:
Describe your company, product, announcement or event. The more detailed your description, the better the result.

Example: Our startup DataCorp has developed a new AI platform that analyzes company data 10x faster than traditional tools. The platform uses machine learning and can...
contentStep.tip1: Mention specific numbers and facts (e.g. 50% growth, 10,000 users)
contentStep.tip2: Describe the unique selling proposition clearly
contentStep.tip3: Mention the target audience and their benefits
contentStep.tip4: Provide context about the current market situation
contentStep.tip5: Add relevant people with names and positions
contentStep.expertModeDescription: The AI uses the {count} selected planning documents as context. Optionally provide additional instructions or leave empty for automatic generation.

generationStep.creatingHeading: ‚ú® Your press release is being created...
generationStep.creatingDescription: The AI is analyzing your input and writing a professional text.
generationStep.doneDescription: The press release was successfully created.
generationStep.step1: Topic and context are being analyzed
generationStep.step2: Structure and outline are being created
generationStep.step3: Content is being formulated and optimized

reviewStep.successDescription: The content will be automatically transferred to the respective fields.
reviewStep.ctaOptimizationHint: Will be formatted as CTA element for better SEO scores
